meanings.definition: A goal that is part of a larger goal.
meanings.sent1: My subgoal is to finish my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: She always breaks down her big project into subgoals to make it more manageable.
meanings.sent3: I told my friend my subgoal is to eat all the chocolate in the house before anyone else does.
meanings.sent4: Each subgoal is like a puzzle piece that fits into the larger picture of success.
meanings.sent5: The subgoal of learning to ride a bike is mastering the art of balancing.

meanings.definition: To set smaller goals to achieve a larger goal.
meanings.sent1: I subgoal my tasks to make them easier to accomplish.
meanings.sent2: They subgoal their savings to buy a new car next year.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel subgoals its nut gathering by storing them in different places.
meanings.sent4: She subgoals her study sessions like stepping stones towards acing the exam.
meanings.sent5: Subgoaling your journey can make the destination seem less daunting.
